help.short: The name of the Web Application Firewall Policy.
The name of the Web Application Firewall Policy.
The name of the Web Application Firewall Policy.
Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource location.
Resource tags.
Defines the Captcha cookie validity lifetime in minutes. This setting is only applicable to Premium_AzureFrontDoor. Value must be an integer between 5 and 1440 with the default value being 30.
If the action type is block, customer can override the response body. The body must be specified in base64 encoding.
If the action type is block, customer can override the response status code.
Describes if the policy is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.
Defines the JavaScript challenge cookie validity lifetime in minutes. Value must be an integer between 5 and 1440 with the default value being 30.

Defines rules that scrub sensitive fields in the Web Application Firewall logs. Example: --log-scrubbing "{scrubbing-rules:[{match-variable:QueryStringArgNames,selector-match-operator:EqualsAny}],state:Enabled}, --log-scrubbing scrubbing-rules=[] state=Disabled, --log-scrubbing null
List of log scrubbing rules applied to the Web Application Firewall logs.
The variable to be scrubbed from the logs.
When matchVariable is a collection, operator used to specify which elements in the collection this rule applies to.
When matchVariable is a collection, operate on the selector to specify which elements in the collection this rule applies to.
Defines the state of a log scrubbing rule. Default value is enabled.
State of the log scrubbing config. Default value is Enabled.
Describes if it is in detection mode or prevention mode at policy level.
If action type is redirect, this field represents redirect URL for the client.
Describes if policy managed rules will inspect the request body content.
Describes custom rules inside the policy.
List of rules
Describes what action to be applied when rule matches.
Describes if the custom rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.
Describes the list of variables to group the rate limit requests
Describes the supported variable for group by
List of match conditions.
List of possible match values.
Request variable to compare with.
Describes if the result of this condition should be negated.
Comparison type to use for matching with the variable value.
Match against a specific key from the QueryString, PostArgs, RequestHeader or Cookies variables. Default is null.
List of transforms.
Describes the name of the rule.
Describes priority of the rule. Rules with a lower value will be evaluated before rules with a higher value.
Time window for resetting the rate limit count. Default is 1 minute.
Number of allowed requests per client within the time window.
Describes type of rule.
Describes managed rules inside the policy.
List of rule sets.
Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the set.
The variable type to be excluded.
Selector value for which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.
Comparison operator to apply to the selector when specifying which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.
Defines the rule group overrides to apply to the rule set.
Describes the exclusions that are applied to all rules in the group.
Describes the managed rule group to override.
List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.
Describes the override action to be applied when rule matches.
Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.
Describes the exclusions that are applied to this specific rule.
Identifier for the managed rule.
Defines the rule set action.
Defines the rule set type to use.
Defines the version of the rule set to use.
Name of the pricing tier.
The name of the Web Application Firewall Policy.
Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource location.
Resource tags.

If the action type is block, customer can override the response status code.
Describes if the policy is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Enabled if not specified.

Describes the managed rule group to override.
List of rules that will be disabled. If none specified, all rules in the group will be disabled.
Describes the override action to be applied when rule matches.
Describes if the managed rule is in enabled or disabled state. Defaults to Disabled if not specified.
Describes the exclusions that are applied to this specific rule.
Identifier for the managed rule.
Defines the rule set action.
Defines the rule set type to use.
